T·ªëi ∆∞u h√≥a trong Khoa h·ªçc D·ªØ li·ªáu

Trang ch·ªß 00. C√°c Kh√°i Ni·ªám To√°n H·ªçc C∆° B·∫£n 01. Gi·ªõi thi·ªáu 02. T·∫≠p L·ªìi 03. H√†m L·ªìi 04. C∆° b·∫£n v·ªÅ T·ªëi ∆∞u h√≥a L·ªìi 05. C√°c B√†i To√°n Chu·∫©n 06. Gradient Descent 07. Subgradient 08. Subgradient Method 09. Proximal Gradient Descent and Acceleration 10. Duality in Linear Programs 11. Duality in General Programs 12. KKT Conditions 13. Duality uses and correspondences 14. Newton's Method 16. Duality Revisited 18. Quasi-Newton Methods 19. Proximal Netwon Method

T·ªëi ∆∞u h√≥a trong Khoa h·ªçc D·ªØ li·ªáu

Chuy·ªÉn sang ti·∫øng Anh

05-02 Quy Ho·∫°ch B·∫≠c Hai (QP) B·∫Øt bu·ªôc

M·ªôt Ch∆∞∆°ng tr√¨nh B·∫≠c hai (QP) l√† m·ªôt b√†i to√°n t·ªëi ∆∞u l·ªìi trong ƒë√≥ h√†m m·ª•c ti√™u l√† m·ªôt h√†m b·∫≠c hai l·ªìi v√† t·∫•t c·∫£ c√°c h√†m r√†ng bu·ªôc ƒë·ªÅu l√† affine. Ch∆∞∆°ng tr√¨nh b·∫≠c hai t·ªïng qu√°t ƒë∆∞·ª£c ph√°t bi·ªÉu nh∆∞:

Ch∆∞∆°ng tr√¨nh B·∫≠c hai T·ªïng qu√°t

\(\begin{align} \text{minimize}_{x} \quad &\frac{1}{2}x^T P x + q^T x + r \\ \text{subject to} \quad &Gx \preceq h \\ &Ax = b \end{align}\)

trong ƒë√≥:

  • \(P \in \mathbb{S}_{+}^n\) (ma tr·∫≠n b√°n x√°c ƒë·ªãnh d∆∞∆°ng)
  • \(G \in \mathbb{R}^{m \times n}\) (ma tr·∫≠n r√†ng bu·ªôc b·∫•t ƒë·∫≥ng th·ª©c)
  • \(A \in \mathbb{R}^{p \times n}\) (ma tr·∫≠n r√†ng bu·ªôc ƒë·∫≥ng th·ª©c)
  • \(x \in \mathbb{R}^n\) (bi·∫øn quy·∫øt ƒë·ªãnh)

T√≠nh ch·∫•t Ch√≠nh c·ªßa QP:

  • H·∫±ng s·ªë \(r\) trong h√†m m·ª•c ti√™u kh√¥ng ·∫£nh h∆∞·ªüng ƒë·∫øn qu√° tr√¨nh t·ªëi ∆∞u h√≥a ho·∫∑c k·∫øt qu·∫£ v√† c√≥ th·ªÉ b·ªè qua.
  • N·∫øu \(P \in \mathbb{S}_{+}^n\) kh√¥ng ƒë∆∞·ª£c th·ªèa m√£n, b√†i to√°n kh√¥ng l·ªìi.
  • Ngay c·∫£ khi kh√¥ng ƒë∆∞·ª£c n√™u r√µ, QP gi·∫£ ƒë·ªãnh \(P \in \mathbb{S}_{+}^n\).
  • B√†i to√°n tr√™n t√¨m nghi·ªám t·ªëi ∆∞u \(x^*\) c·ªßa h√†m b·∫≠c hai l·ªìi \(\frac{1}{2}x^T P x + q^T x + r\) tr√™n m·ªôt t·∫≠p kh·∫£ thi ƒëa di·ªán.

Hi·ªÉu v·ªÅ \(\mathbb{S}_{+}^n\) (N√≥n B√°n x√°c ƒë·ªãnh D∆∞∆°ng)

K√Ω hi·ªáu \(\mathbb{S}_{+}^n\) ƒë·∫°i di·ªán cho n√≥n b√°n x√°c ƒë·ªãnh d∆∞∆°ng, ƒë√¢y l√† m·ªôt kh√°i ni·ªám c∆° b·∫£n trong t·ªëi ∆∞u l·ªìi:

ƒê·ªãnh nghƒ©a:

\[\mathbb{S}_{+}^n = \{ X \in \mathbb{S}^n : X \succeq 0 \}\]

trong ƒë√≥:

  • \(\mathbb{S}^n\) l√† t·∫≠p t·∫•t c·∫£ c√°c ma tr·∫≠n ƒë·ªëi x·ª©ng \(n \times n\)
  • \(X \succeq 0\) c√≥ nghƒ©a l√† ma tr·∫≠n \(X\) l√† b√°n x√°c ƒë·ªãnh d∆∞∆°ng

T√≠nh ch·∫•t Ch√≠nh:

  1. ƒêi·ªÅu ki·ªán b√°n x√°c ƒë·ªãnh d∆∞∆°ng: M·ªôt ma tr·∫≠n \(P\) l√† b√°n x√°c ƒë·ªãnh d∆∞∆°ng n·∫øu:
    • T·∫•t c·∫£ c√°c gi√° tr·ªã ri√™ng c·ªßa \(P\) ƒë·ªÅu kh√¥ng √¢m (\(\lambda_i \geq 0\))
    • V·ªõi m·ªçi vector \(v\), ch√∫ng ta c√≥ \(v^T P v \geq 0\)
  2. T√≠nh ch·∫•t n√≥n l·ªìi: \(\mathbb{S}_{+}^n\) l√† m·ªôt n√≥n l·ªìi v√¨ n·∫øu \(\theta_1, \theta_2 \geq 0\) v√† \(A, B \in \mathbb{S}_{+}^n\), th√¨ \(\theta_1 A + \theta_2 B \in \mathbb{S}_{+}^n\)

V√≠ d·ª• cho \(n=2\): V·ªõi ma tr·∫≠n \(2 \times 2\) \(P = \begin{bmatrix} a & b \\ b & c \end{bmatrix}\), ƒëi·ªÅu ki·ªán \(P \in \mathbb{S}_{+}^2\) y√™u c·∫ßu:

  • \(a \geq 0\) (c√°c ph·∫ßn t·ª≠ ƒë∆∞·ªùng ch√©o kh√¥ng √¢m)
  • \(c \geq 0\) (c√°c ph·∫ßn t·ª≠ ƒë∆∞·ªùng ch√©o kh√¥ng √¢m)
  • \(ac \geq b^2\) (ƒë·ªãnh th·ª©c kh√¥ng √¢m)

T·∫°i sao ƒëi·ªÅu n√†y quan tr·ªçng ƒë·ªëi v·ªõi QP?

  • ƒêi·ªÅu ki·ªán \(P \in \mathbb{S}_{+}^n\) ƒë·∫£m b·∫£o r·∫±ng h√†m b·∫≠c hai \((1/2)x^T P x + q^T x + r\) l√† l·ªìi
  • Kh√¥ng c√≥ ƒëi·ªÅu ki·ªán n√†y, b√†i to√°n c√≥ th·ªÉ c√≥ nhi·ªÅu c·ª±c ti·ªÉu ƒë·ªãa ph∆∞∆°ng v√† s·∫Ω kh√¥ng l√† m·ªôt b√†i to√°n t·ªëi ∆∞u l·ªìi
  • ƒêi·ªÅu n√†y ƒë·∫£m b·∫£o r·∫±ng b·∫•t k·ª≥ c·ª±c ti·ªÉu ƒë·ªãa ph∆∞∆°ng n√†o c≈©ng l√† c·ª±c ti·ªÉu to√†n c·ª•c

Hi·ªÉu v·ªÅ \(Gx \preceq h\) (B·∫•t ƒë·∫≥ng th·ª©c Theo th√†nh ph·∫ßn)

K√Ω hi·ªáu \(Gx \preceq h\) ƒë·∫°i di·ªán cho r√†ng bu·ªôc b·∫•t ƒë·∫≥ng th·ª©c theo th√†nh ph·∫ßn, ƒë√¢y l√† c√°ch g·ªçn g√†ng ƒë·ªÉ vi·∫øt nhi·ªÅu r√†ng bu·ªôc b·∫•t ƒë·∫≥ng th·ª©c tuy·∫øn t√≠nh:

ƒê·ªãnh nghƒ©a: \(Gx \preceq h \quad \Leftrightarrow \quad (Gx)_i \leq h_i \text{ v·ªõi m·ªçi } i = 1, 2, \ldots, m\)

where:

  • \(G \in \mathbb{R}^{m \times n}\) is the constraint matrix
  • \(x \in \mathbb{R}^n\) is the decision variable vector
  • \(h \in \mathbb{R}^m\) is the right-hand side vector
  • \(m\) is the number of inequality constraints

Expanded Form: The single matrix inequality \(Gx \preceq h\) is equivalent to the system: \(\begin{align} g_1^T x &\leq h_1 \\ g_2^T x &\leq h_2 \\ &\vdots \\ g_m^T x &\leq h_m \end{align}\)

where \(g_i^T\) is the \(i\)-th row of matrix \(G\).

Example: Consider \(G = \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 2 \\ -1 & 3 \\ 0 & -1 \end{bmatrix}\), \(x = \begin{bmatrix} x_1 \\ x_2 \end{bmatrix}\), and \(h = \begin{bmatrix} 5 \\ 2 \\ -1 \end{bmatrix}\)

Then \(Gx \preceq h\) means: \(\begin{align} x_1 + 2x_2 &\leq 5 \\ -x_1 + 3x_2 &\leq 2 \\ -x_2 &\leq -1 \quad \text{(i.e., } x_2 \geq 1\text{)} \end{align}\)

Geometric Interpretation:

  • Each inequality \(g_i^T x \leq h_i\) defines a half-space in \(\mathbb{R}^n\)
  • The feasible region is the intersection of all these half-spaces
  • This intersection forms a polyhedron (or polytope if bounded)
  • The constraint \(Gx \preceq h\) defines the polyhedral feasible set for the QP

QP in Standard Form

The standard form of a quadratic program is:

Standard Form QP

\(\begin{align} \text{minimize}_{x} \quad &\frac{1}{2}x^T P x + q^T x + r \\ \text{subject to} \quad &A x = b \\ &x \succeq 0 \end{align}\)

Any general quadratic program can be converted to standard form using the following steps:

Converting QPs to Standard Form

Step 1. Use slack variables \(s\) to convert inequality constraints into equality constraints: \(\begin{align} \text{minimize}_{x, s} \quad &\frac{1}{2}x^T P x + q^T x + r \\ \text{subject to} \quad &Gx + s = h \\ &Ax = b \\ &s \succeq 0 \end{align}\)

Step 2. Replace \(x\) with two nonnegative variables: \(x = x^{+} - x^{-}, \quad \text{where } x^{+}, x^{-} \succeq 0\)

\[\begin{align} \text{minimize}_{x^{+}, x^{-}, s} \quad &\frac{1}{2}(x^{+} - x^{-})^T P (x^{+} - x^{-}) + q^T x^{+} - q^T x^{-} + r\\ \text{subject to} \quad &Gx^{+} - Gx^{-} + s = h \\ &Ax^{+} - Ax^{-} = b \\ &s \succeq 0 \\ &x^{+} \succeq 0, \quad x^{-} \succeq 0 \end{align}\]

Step 3. Define \(\tilde{x}\), \(\tilde{q}\), \(\tilde{b}\), \(\tilde{A}\), \(\tilde{P}\):

\[\tilde{x} = \begin{bmatrix} x^{+} \\ x^{-} \\ s \end{bmatrix}, \quad \tilde{q} = \begin{bmatrix} q \\ -q \\ 0 \end{bmatrix}, \quad \tilde{b} = \begin{bmatrix} h \\ b \end{bmatrix}\] \[\tilde{A} = \begin{bmatrix} G & -G & I \\ A & -A & O \end{bmatrix}, \quad \tilde{P} = \begin{bmatrix} P & -P & O \\ -P & P & O \\ O & O & O \end{bmatrix}\]

Step 4. Substitute the expressions from Step 3 into the formulation:

\[\begin{align} \text{minimize}_{\tilde{x}} \quad &\frac{1}{2}\tilde{x}^T \tilde{P} \tilde{x} + \tilde{q}^T \tilde{x} + r \\ \text{subject to} \quad &\tilde{A} \tilde{x} = \tilde{b} \\ &\tilde{x} \succeq 0 \end{align}\]

Linear Programming as a Special Case of QP

If the quadratic term is removed from the objective function of a quadratic program, it takes the form of a linear program. Thus, LP is a special case of QP, denoted as LP \(\subseteq\) QP.

Recall: General LP

\(\begin{align} \text{minimize}_{x} \quad &c^T x + d \\ \text{subject to} \quad &Gx \preceq h \\ &Ax = b \end{align}\) where \(G \in \mathbb{R}^{m \times n}\) and \(A \in \mathbb{R}^{p \times n}\).

V√≠ d·ª• 1: T·ªëi ∆∞u h√≥a Danh m·ª•c ƒê·∫ßu t∆∞

B√†i to√°n n√†y bao g·ªìm vi·ªác c√¢n b·∫±ng h·ª£p l√Ω gi·ªØa hi·ªáu su·∫•t v√† r·ªßi ro khi t·∫°o m·ªôt danh m·ª•c t√†i ch√≠nh.

\[\begin{align} \text{maximize}_{x} \quad &\mu^T x - \frac{\gamma}{2}x^T P x \\ \text{subject to} \quad &\mathbf{1}^Tx = 1 \\ &x \succeq 0 \end{align}\]

trong ƒë√≥:

  • \(\mu\): l·ª£i nhu·∫≠n k·ª≥ v·ªçng c·ªßa c√°c t√†i s·∫£n
  • \(P\): ma tr·∫≠n hi·ªáp ph∆∞∆°ng sai c·ªßa l·ª£i nhu·∫≠n t√†i s·∫£n
  • \(\gamma\): tham s·ªë tr√°nh r·ªßi ro (si√™u tham s·ªë)
  • \(x\): n·∫Øm gi·ªØ danh m·ª•c (ph·∫ßn trƒÉm)

V√≠ d·ª• 2: M√°y Vector H·ªó tr·ª£

M√°y Vector H·ªó tr·ª£ (SVM) l√† m·ªôt v√≠ d·ª• c·ªßa ch∆∞∆°ng tr√¨nh b·∫≠c hai. D∆∞·ªõi ƒë√¢y l√† C-SVM, m·ªôt bi·∫øn th·ªÉ c·ªßa SVM. Gi·∫£i th√≠ch chi ti·∫øt v·ªÅ SVM n·∫±m ngo√†i ph·∫°m vi c·ªßa ch∆∞∆°ng n√†y v√† do ƒë√≥ s·∫Ω ƒë∆∞·ª£c b·ªè qua.

\[\begin{align} \text{minimize}_{\beta, \beta_0, \xi} \quad &\frac{1}{2} \| \beta \|_2^2 + C \sum_{i=1}^{n} \xi_i \\ \text{subject to} \quad &\xi_i \geq 0, \quad i = 1, \ldots, n \\ &y_i (x_i^T \beta + \beta_0) \geq 1 - \xi_i, \quad i = 1, \ldots, n \end{align}\]

cho tr∆∞·ªõc: \(y \in \{-1, 1\}^n\) v√† \(X \in \mathbb{R}^{n \times p}\) c√≥ c√°c h√†ng \(x_1, \ldots, x_n\).

V√≠ d·ª• 3: B√¨nh ph∆∞∆°ng T·ªëi thi·ªÉu trong H·ªìi quy

B√†i to√°n t·ªëi thi·ªÉu h√≥a h√†m b·∫≠c hai l·ªìi sau t∆∞∆°ng ·ª©ng v·ªõi m·ªôt QP (kh√¥ng r√†ng bu·ªôc): \(\| Ax - b \|_2^2 = x^T A^TA x - 2b^TAx + b^Tb\)

‚Üê Quay l·∫°i ƒë·∫ßu ch∆∞∆°ng
